algorithm_technique: Two pointers moving inwards, always advancing the pointer of the shorter line to maximize potential area.
problem_summary_simple: Find two vertical lines that form a container with the most water.
problem_summary_technical: Maximize area (width * min_height) between two lines in an array using two pointers that converge.
key_insights: The area is limited by the shorter of the two lines.
Moving the pointer of the shorter line is the only way to potentially increase the area.
This greedy approach guarantees finding the maximum area.
